thread.title: Coyl leads Joliet West football to comeback win
thread.title_full: Coyl leads Joliet West football to comeback win

title: Coyl leads Joliet West football to comeback win
text:
Coyl leads Joliet West football to comeback win Published: Friday, Oct. 16, 2015 11:22 p.m. CDT By LARRY LINDHOLM - Shaw Media Correspondent 
JOLIET â€“ Joliet West dug itself out of a 21-0 first-quarter hole Friday night, came back to force overtime and scored a huge 28-27 SouthWest Suburban Blue victory over Stagg. Related Links Plainfield North has no trouble with Romeoville 
Jakob Coyl ran for 171 yards on 23 carries, including the all-important 10 yards on three carries in overtime. He scored four touchdowns. After his overtime touchdown, Brian Epps kicked the extra point to make it 28-21. 
Stagg then took its turn on offense and scored a touchdown. The Chargers went for a two-point conversion and the win, but the Tigers' defense made the stop at the 2-yard line to end it. 
West (4-4, 2-4) needed the victory to keep its playoff hopes alive. The Tigers also must win next week at Lockport. 
West fumbled on first three possessions and Stagg converted the turnovers into a 21-0 lead. The Tigers got on the board with 6:16 left in the second quarter on a 5-yard run by Coyl. He scored again with 1:15 left in the half on a 2-yard run, which was set up by a 68-yard pass from Jaxon Aubry to Xavior Smith. Coyl's third touchdown tied the game 21-21 with 9:33 left. 
West's defense held Stagg to 55 yards rushing and 34 yards passing in the second half.
